Posts.Content: Hi Guys. Well it been about 2 years since my last post and surgery and all has been going fine. still no real movement in my manhood but that was expected ( Non-Sparing surgery), and leakage only once in a while, but no big issue. The problem is my last PSA test came back .1 all along it has been undetectable. I have been going to Sloan every 6 months and all have come back <.05 my reg.Dr. has also been checking it once a year ( Regular PSA total Test) and that has been coming back at <.1 so all good until this last test from my dr which came back at =.1 so it went from <.05 on 5/18 to .1 on 10/18. that is fairly quick doubling time. Any thoughts? I am going to get it checked again this week. 12/17/2016 Surgery Surgical Pathology: Focal extracapsular extension: The location of the extracapsular extension is left posterior mid Surgical Margins: Tumor present at apical margin Tumor present at left anterior margin Staging pT3a (extracapsular extension) PSA Tests uPSA 2/17 = <.05 (Sloan) PSA 4/17 = <.1 (Dr) uPSA 5/17 = <.05 (Sloan) PSA 9/17 = <.1 (DR.) uPSA 11/17= <.05 (Sloan) uPSA 5/18 = <.05 (Sloan) PSA 10/18 = .1 (Dr). WHAT ????? going for recheck
Posts.Signature: PSA Nov 2015 1.9 Sept 2016 CT scan ( for unrelated matter) showed nodule on APEX of Prostate, prostate indenting the Bladder. Sept 2016 PSA was 2.5 09/28/16 Off to Urologist, Physical exam Positive DRE, need biopsy 10/13/16 Biopsy 15 core sample (3 from the Nodule) 10/19/16 Biopsy results 12/15 samples positive - Gleason 7= 3+4 PNI (Perineural Invasion present) in 4 cores. Clinical Stage T3 12/17/2016 Surgery Sloan Surgical Pathology: Focal extracapsular extension: The location of the extracapsular extension is left posterior mid Surgical Margins: Tumor present at apical margin Tumor present at left anterior margin Staging pT3a (extracapsular extension) PSA Tests uPSA 2/17 = <.05 (Sloan) PSA 4/17 = <.1 (Dr) uPSA 5/17 = <.05 (Sloan) PSA 9/17 = <.1 (DR.) uPSA 11/17= <.05 (Sloan) uPSA 5/18 = <.05 (Sloan) [B]PSA 10/18 = .1 (Dr). WHAT ????? going for recheck
Posts.Title: 2 years Post-Prostatecotomy PSA Rising ?,

Posts.Content: thanks Dj for the reply. I never ask my regular Dr to check my Psa. he just does it with my regular blood work every so often ( once a year or so, guess he is just. trying to be thorough). I am going to him tomorrow and seeing if he can do a PSA Post Prostatectomy blood test with quest which goes out two decimal point places instead of the Total PSA test which he does I am also calling Sloan to see if they can push up my Regular uPSA test which is set for Nov 15 th. and try to get it done this week instead, I am just hoping the .1 is wrong

Posts.Content: Rylee, Here is info right from the book, TNM Staging system , I just got it myself and it is very helpful. T1a: Not Palpable in DRE. found incidentally, when tissue is removed by a TUR:5% or less of the removed tissue is cancerous T1b: Not Palpable in DRE. Greater than 5% of the removed tissue is cancerous T1c: Not Palpable in DRE, identified by needle biopsy because of elevated PSA level T2a Palpable: involves less than half of one lobe of the prostate T2b Palpable: involves more than half of one lobe but not both lobes of the prostate T2c Palpable: involves both lobes of the prostate T3,T4 palpable : penetrates the wall of the prostate and /or involves the seminal vesicles I hope this helps, but like the advise above the book is excellent by Dr Patrick Walsh, Surviving Prostate Cancer
Posts.Title: Prostate cancer stage?

Posts.Content: Hi, Had my surgery on Dec 17th and I am doing great, a little slow on incontinence front, a lot of dribbling, and nothing is happening in the erection front but this will take time. My final Pathology report came back with a few concerns and would love some advise on what to do if anything. Final Grading was pT3a Gleason 7 3+4 lymph nodes 0 Surgical Margins 2: Tumor present at apical margin Tumor present at left anterior margin Focal extracapsular extension The location of the extracapsular extension is left posterior mid Should I get treatment with Rad in a few months? Most of the articles I read say with the positive margins and EPE you should get extra treatment? or should I wait until PSA testing ? My doctor is a wait and see guy in general so I know what he will say at our next meeting.

Posts.Title: Final Pathology report- Should I do Rad next ?

Posts.Content: Thanks for all the information, I will be going to MSKK (Sloan) this Friday. Do you think they will suggest radiation after surgery due to the number of Positive cores and % along with the +DRE ? I was a little surprised at the number of positive cores, it seems like the whole prostate in infected. also most of the PNI is near the base by the Seminal Vesicles and the nodule on the apex
Posts.Title: Biopsy Results in, now what?

Posts.Content: I received my result the other day and my Dr told me the following 12/15 samples positive - Gleason 7= 3+4 positive in following Samples: right base 70%, right lateral base 15%,right mid 85%, right lateral mid 100%, right apex 50%, right lateral apex 15%, left lateral base 35%, left mid 5%, left apex 40%, apical nodule 40% Multiple cores (3) PNI (Perineural Invasion present) in 4 cores. my age is 55 Before Biopsy CT showed nodule on apex of prostate (this is why I went to urologist) DRE positive PSA 2.5 was 1.5 10 months ago I will going back to DR soon, I guess he may suggest surgery, what I am concerned about is the PNI in four cores and the nodule. I have read this may show aggression, I will be sending my slide to Johns Hopkins for a second opinion soon, any advise on surgery that may help , open vs robotic? Looks like basically the whole prostate has cancer, 12out of 15, does this also determine treatment options ? Any reply or experience is helpful.

Posts.Content: Hi, I am new to this, so please excuse my ignorance on this subject. Below are the results of a CT scan I had for diverticulitis before a colonoscopy I will have on 10/11/2016. CT results pelvic :Prostate shows heterogeneous density and nodular apex indenting the base of the bladder. It measures about 6.3 x 3.9 x 5.4 cm (CCxAPxW). There is no suspicious pelvic adenopathy I was told to make appointment with a Urologist, which I did. He stated that he can feel the nodule and it is NOT small. I had a PSA test back on 11/2016 was 1.9 and another on 9/2016 (after results of CT scan) it was 2.5 . The Urologist said he did not like the velocity and the fact that he can feel the Nodule, coupled with the fact that I am only 55 and healthy I should have a biopsy( on 10/13). Should I be worried? is the prostate large? Is it worse that the nodule is on the apex ? What % of nodules are cancerous ? I do have issues urinating. Any input will be helpful thank you
Posts.Title: CT scan and DRE shows issue with my prostate, confused

Posts.Content: Thanks for the advice I forgot to ask , do antibiotics effect a PSA test results. I was on 10 days of Ciprofloxacin and Moxifloxacin for diverticulitis, two days later I had blood test for PSA. I did not tell my Urologist this ( a mistake). some say this may lower the PSA results. Is this true?
